title: vEmpire-DDAO
author: vEmpire-DDAO
content: P2E game Axie Infinity is back on the menu, as we're seeing a 205% rise in NTF sales volume just since the last week. Axie has generated more than $1.3 million from selling NFTs over the last seven daysOne of the factors that contributed to the sudden increase seems to be investors' sudden love for the Axie Land NFTs, which give weekly rewards in Axie's AXS tokens. As of now, more than 90% of the tokens were staked. Jeff Zirlin, the project's co-founder said that "nature was healing", hinting at the project's restoration.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: It used to be $80 (0.02 eth) for an axie, now it's $6 (0.005) I don't think it's really going that well for them over there.It's a better price though to get going with easting out nfts now which I don't think is too much of a bad thing $240 for an experiment is definitely worse than $18 (though I don't think an investment to experiment with the game is required anymore).

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: This increasement in volume hasn't impacted SLPs positively so far, since they are still pricing dust of cents of dollar (US$ 0,003). Actually SLP has hit its bottom today. Developers need to create new usages for SLP in order to boost its demand and price again. The last major update which removed rewards from adventure mode didn't help SLP price balance and stability in anyways. It seems it happened exactly the opposite, because many players don't like PVP mode, so they just lost interest for the game once they were forced to play against other players for rewards.But I can't blame Axie at all. It is the most successful NFT game of the industry, which has been efficient in fighting cheaters and keeping the environment sustainable for a long time already. And that is not too little for a limited game which doesn't offer many features, diferent from mmorpgs of the same NFT niche which could be on the top of the world, but aren't because they do nothing to stop bots, scammers and abusers in general.
